_decoded_content.title: Getting Help links to the contributor docs
_decoded_content.description:
Getting Help link on https://docs.meltano.com/guide/installation links to https://docs.meltano.com/contribute/ . 

Maybe there could be a "Help" page that points to Slack/Stackoverflow? I don't know where to fix this but it does seem like a great place to direct people to start a feedback loop for where folks get stuck in documentation.

_decoded_content.title: Document how to use alternative PyPI indexes
_decoded_content.description:
https://docs.meltano.com/concepts/plugins#project-plugins

The docs linked above explains that you need to tell Meltano where to obtain a Python package for a plugin, and that it can be identified by its name on PyPI:
> where to find the package, typically a pip package identified by its name on PyPI, public or private Git repository URL, or local directory path,

In this case "on PyPI" refers to the default PyPI server at https://pypi.org/. I was not able to find an explanation for how one would use an alternative PyPI index server, e.g. from a mirror, or an internal company server (possibly provided by Nexus, or even something like [simplepypi](https://github.com/steiza/simplepypi)).

_decoded_content.title: Update syntax highlighting theme in docs
_decoded_content.description: The current syntax highlighter theme doesn't fit the brand guidelines and looks a little out of place. It would be nice to update this to match the rest of the site at some point.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description:
As a start, I think it would be good to prioritize based on:
- urgency of getting feedback
- relative implementation difficulty
- symbiotic relationships between issues

_decoded_content.title: Expand feature flags docs entry in CONTRIBUTING.md guide
_decoded_content.description:
(This is a stub. cc @pandemicsyn @edgarrmondragon @cjohnhanson )

We have a feature flag section in contributing guide: https://docs.meltano.com/contribute/style#feature-flags

A few additions would be super helpful here, I think:

1. Add guidance for what the docs entry should say inline of other feature documentation.
   - E.g. something similar to: `This feature is experimental and must be enabled using feature flags. See the docs here: ...`
1. For contributors, I think we need to mention what they should add to `settings.yml`.
1. Should we have an index in docs of all the known/current feature flags, what they do, and what their defaults are?
2. Because we are favoring individual flags, I think replacing `EXPERIMENTAL` with the Lock files example or a similarly named setting would be helpful within the code snippet.

This would be a good follow up to the lock files issue but also as guidance for !2644.

_decoded_content.title: Suggestion: Move Environments to its own page
_decoded_content.description: "Environments" lives in the Installation Guide but might be better suited to its own page in the docs so we can flesh it out.

_decoded_content.title: Add feature flag blurb(s) for users
_decoded_content.description:
@cjohnhanson, @edgarrmondragon, @pandemicsyn, and @tayloramurphy - Do we have any docs yet on how users should think of feature flags and how they can set/customize these for their needs?

I thought of this as I was reviewing the docs for the Lock files MR: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/2596/diffs#cec94220eb8ca8b0a9f6330849d8220d22cbcb6b_109_109

We mention the feature in the docs, but I wonder if we should annotate it with something like:

> Note: This feature is in experimental status as of `<version ref>` and is disabled by default. You can enable the feature for your environment by setting the environment variable `MELTANO_FF_LOCK_FILES=1`. More information on enabling and disabling features is at `[link]`.

Post-2.0 the message might be:

> Note: This feature requires `<version ref>` or later.



Or for those we've already deprecated:

> Note: This feature is in deprecated status as of `<version ref>` and is disabled by default. You can enable the feature for your environment by setting the environment variable `<example-goes-here>`. More information on enabling and disabling features is at `[link]`.

_decoded_content.title: Document various useful logging.yaml config examples
_decoded_content.description:
Would be nice to document various logging.yaml config examples. Couple of ideas:

1. A config examples for local dev
2. A general go to prod config 
3. A go to prod config where the console is consumed by a machine
4. A go to prod config where a log file is consumed by a machine
   - a variation showing automatically rotated logs for long lived deploys 
5. explicit config example to turn off colored console output
6. explicit config example that uses a custom log line format
7. explicit config examples showing filtering

/cc @vischous any other explicit examples that you think would useful ?

_decoded_content.title: Installation instructions point to examples on the homepage that don't exist
_decoded_content.description:
```

To get a sense of the Meltano experience in just a few minutes, follow the examples on the homepage or watch the "from 0 to ELT in 90 seconds" speedrun

``` This example doesn't exist anymore on the homepage.

_decoded_content.title: Documentation Tests
_decoded_content.description:
In our documentation we have examples of commands that we'd like users to run. We should test that these commands continue to work as we make change to Meltano, environments (like Python) change, and more!

https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/2636#note_940245155

I don't have a library in mind, I know back in my "groovy" days all of the code they have linked on their documentation is tested as a part of CI. Here's an example 
- Website: https://groovy-lang.org/processing-yaml.html 
- Actual Test: https://github.com/apache/groovy/blob/b3fd3e830bc348dc55190bc14351259e35db43d2/subprojects/groovy-yaml/src/spec/test/groovy/yaml/YamlParserTest.groovy#L24-L50 
- ascii docs: https://github.com/apache/groovy/blob/e6ce56fc27e7640664946eb1a99bdee6fb63547e/subprojects/groovy-yaml/src/spec/doc/yaml-userguide.adoc

_decoded_content.title: VirtualENV Advanced Concept - Documentation
_decoded_content.description: Add a VirtualENV Advanced Concept Page. Created from the discussion here https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/2638#note_940235684

_decoded_content.title: Increase contrast between code blocks and page color
_decoded_content.description:
The color difference between a code block and non code block is very hard to tell the difference between.

![image](/uploads/84320cca2b8bfb49e12e17893566faf4/image.png)

_decoded_content.title: What is Path, venvs, processes, stdout, stderr, stdin, pipes? - Docs explanation
_decoded_content.description:
I've seen more than one person get stuck up on what "Path" actually is, how it relates to running a process, stdout, stdin, and how Meltano handles pipes. 

*venvs
*processes
*stdout, stderr, stdin
*Piping processes

I think when people get this deep they tend to not go farther because it's time consuming. A Meltano focuses description of these would help a number of Folks out, especially when you get into the nitty gritty of writing your own CI pipelines and getting Meltano into production. 

Just an idea, maybe it's a bit too much.

_decoded_content.title: Create process for updating docs as part of release
_decoded_content.description: I realized during @tayloramurphy's presentation in Demo Day today that the `meltano state` command was already in the CLI docs even though it hadn't been released yet. The docs were only out of sync for ~1 day in this case but as we grow and deliver more features this could cause confusion for users if docs are out of sync for several days at a time. We should have a process for gating docs updates until the associated code changes are released.

_decoded_content.title: Docs 404 Page
_decoded_content.description: The docs currently display a generic Netlify 404 page. We should create our own page that leads folks to resources they may have been looking for and links to places where they can get help if they're stuck.

_decoded_content.title: Add docs redirect capability, including contributor guide instructions
_decoded_content.description:
Per https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/merge_requests/2618#note_925236771, it would be good to have a redirect pattern in place to keep google results caches and other external links working. 

Once we have a pattern in place, we should add to contributing docs so it's easy for team members to create those when needed.

_decoded_content.title: Distinguish sections more clearly in command reference
_decoded_content.description:
Right now, the different sections for commands are distinguished by plain `<h2>'s`, and visually it's really hard to tell where the docs for one command end and another begin. As a quicky fix, could we maybe throw in some horizontal rules at the end of command section's ala:

![Screen_Shot_2022-04-21_at_10.56.02_AM](/uploads/014b41486933ff99ec476a62c2e73b7c/Screen_Shot_2022-04-21_at_10.56.02_AM.png)

Not sure if this needs part of the generation, I can send up an MR to just manually add them maybe?

_decoded_content.title: Documentation for Oauth2 Dance
_decoded_content.description: I don't know where this belongs exactly but it's asked enough https://meltano.slack.com/archives/CMN8HELB0/p1650013852588679 . Maybe we could describe the main types of authentication and how they work, the one people get stuck on is Oauth2 as it's not natural.

As a start, I think it would be good to prioritize based on:

_decoded_content.title: Improve Troubleshooting Docs
_decoded_content.description:
We had some discussions in https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/3394 about logging differently to help users solve their own problems faster and avoid having to come to slack for common issues like bad configs or credential. It sounds like the logs are probably fine and it might be more about the users not knowing how to easily debug on their own.

Theres a [troubleshooting guide](https://docs.meltano.com/guide/integration#troubleshooting) in the docs but its pretty simple - maybe adding a few common cases like `discovery failed` and a step by step to debug it so we can point users there before helping in slack.

@pandemicsyn let me know if you have any thoughts here? I usually just skim the logs so I probably dont have the best recommendations for users.

cc @edgarrmondragon @tayloramurphy @aaronsteers @cjohnhanson @kgpayne if you guys have any good debugging tips and tricks

_decoded_content.title: Migrate Data Integration to Data Replication
_decoded_content.description:
As we move away from `meltano elt` it would make sense to be more accurate about what each page represents. The data integration page should just be focused on data replication with `meltano run`.
